comments.content: Custom logo with some glyphs modified from [ITC Bauhaus](http://web.archive.org/web/20091126054431/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=EF.6733.0.4&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=village+kolektiv&sampleSize=48)

is it similar to this IMAGE  
I´m interests me to know but font with this morphology somebody can help me?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20091126054431im_/http:/typophile.com/files/identy_5358.PNG)

It also sort of reminds me of [Motter Tektura](http://web.archive.org/web/20091126054431/http:/www.paratype.com/pstore/newstyles.asp?fontcode=SU_MTT&f=All&p=All), which was famously used in the [1970s-era Apple Computer logo](http://web.archive.org/web/20091126054431/http:/www.macnyt.dk/?read=20020702221631).

Thanks for the spam, spambot :-/

- Lex

We do guess, you should take the [article submission service](http://web.archive.org/web/20091126054431/http:/www.4submission.com/) for your facts just about this good post, because it is manifestly fantastic and mustn’t be hidden from people!

When I said thanks, I was being sarcastic, other spambot.

- Lex

Someone call a doctor.  
Lex is talking to spambots.
Try to search something related to this good post with another search engine [Bing](http://web.archive.org/web/20091126054431/http:/bing.com/) by MS itself.

Why do spammers always write such drivel?

Nick Cooke
